snippet: The jurors in the S.E.C.’s case against Fabrice Tourre say their decision came down to what they saw as the letter of the law. | A revised agreement over Dell keeps the takeover effort alive. | Clawback policies, though a hot topic, are rarely...
abstract: The jurors in the S.E.C.’s case against Fabrice Tourre say their decision came down to what they saw as the letter of the law. | A revised agreement over Dell keeps the takeover effort alive. | Clawback policies, though a hot topic, are rarely enforced. | Bank of New York Mellon wins a gender bias case.

headline.main: A Focus on Greed in Tourre Case
